QuestionText: A function $f:X\rightarrow Y$ is continuous iff the inverse of each member of a base $B$ for $Y$ is an open subset of $X$.
Let $S$ be a subbase for a topological space $Y$. Then a function $f:X\rightarrow Y$ is continuous uff the inverse of each member of $S$ is an open subset of $X$.
A function $f:X\rightarrow Y$ is continuous iff the inverse image of every closed subset of $Y$ is a closed subset of $X$.
